refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: This is a set of various Samba VFS modules to scan and filter virus files on Samba file services with an anti-virus scanner.

listitem.para: Path of local socket for the virus scanner.
If this option is not set, the default path /var/run/savdi/sssp.sock.
Controls how long to wait on connecting to the virus scanning process before timing out. Value is in milliseconds.
If this option is not set, the default is 30000.
Controls how long to wait on communications with the virus scanning process before timing out. Value is in milliseconds.
If this option is not set, the default is 60000.
This option controls whether files are scanned on open.
If this option is not set, the default is yes.
This option controls whether files are scanned on open.
If this option is not set, the default is no.
This is the largest sized file, in bytes, which will be scanned.
If this option is not set, the default is 100MB.
This is the largest sized file, in bytes, which will be scanned.
If this option is not set, the default is 0.

What to do with an infected file. The options are nothing, quarantine, rename, delete. Rename is alias for quarantine with keep tree and keep name both set to yes. I.e. rename is a quarantine in place.
If this option is not set, the default is nothing.
What errno to return on close if the file is infected.
If this option is not set, the default is 0.

varlistentry.term: svf-sophos:infected file errno on open = EACCES

listitem.para: What errno to return on close if the file is infected.
If this option is not set, the default is EACCES.
Where to move infected files.
Prefix for quarantined files. This option conflicts with svf-sophos:rename prefix.
If this option is not set, the default is "svf.".
Suffix for quarantined files. This option conflicts with svf-sophos:rename suffix. This option is only used if keep name is true. Otherwise it is ignored.
If this option is not set, the default is ".infected".
Prefix for infected files. This option conflicts with svf-sophos:quarantine prefix.
If this option is not set, the default is "svf.".
Suffix for infected files. This option conflicts with svf-sophos:quarantine suffix.
If this option is not set, the default is ".infected".
Should the file simply be renamed in place.
If this option is not set, the default is no.
Should the file name be left unmodified other than adding a suffix and/or prefix as defined in svf-sophos:rename prefix and svf-sophos:rename suffix.
If this option is not set, the default is no.

varlistentry.term: svf-sophos:infected file command = @SAMBA_DATADIR@/bin/svf-notify --mail-to virusmaster@example.com --cc "%U@example.com" --from samba@example.com --subject-prefix "Samba: Infected File: "

listitem.para: External command to run on an infected file is found.
If this option is not set, the default is none.
This defines whether or not to scan archives.
Sophos supports this and defaults to false.
This defines the maximum depth to search nested archives.
The Sophos module supports this and defauls to 1.

varlistentry.term: svf-sophos:scan error command = @SAMBA_DATADIR@/bin/svf-notify --mail-to virusmaster@example.com --from samba@example.com --subject-prefix "Samba: Scan Error: "

listitem.para: External command to run on scan error.
If this option is not set, the default is none.
Files to exclude from scanning.
If this option is not set, the default is empty.
Controls whether or not access should be blocked on a scanning error.
If this option is not set, the default is false.
What errno to return on close if there is an error in scanning the file and block access on error is true.
If this option is not set, the default is 0.

varlistentry.term: svf-sophos:scan error errno on open = EACCES

listitem.para: What errno to return on open if there is an error in scanning the file and block access on error is true.
If this option is not set, the default is EACCES.
The maximum number of entries in the scanning results cache.
If this option is not set, the default is 100.
The maximum number of seconds that a scanning result will stay in the results cache..
If this option is not set, the default is 10.

refsect1.title: VERSION
refsect1.para: This man page is correct for version 4.0 of the Samba suite.

refsect1.title: AUTHOR
refsect1.para: The original Samba software and related utilities were created by Andrew Tridgell. Samba is now developed by the Samba Team as an Open Source project similar to the way the Linux kernel is developed.
